intro: Erica cinerea var. floribunda, commonly known as the silver heath, is a flowering plant native to the western regions of the United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage that is covered in a fine layer of silvery-white wax. Its flowers, which are typically pink or purple, bloom in late spring to early summer. Erica cinerea var. floribunda thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous areas.
